subject: RE: [junit] new to junit
msgSnippet: I am fairly new to JUnit too. I found the following articles helped me a great deal: http://www.clarkware.com/articles/JUnitPrimer.html
messageBody:
I am fairly new to JUnit too. I found the following articles helped me a
great deal:

http://www.clarkware.com/articles/JUnitPrimer.html
http://www.javaworld.com/javaworld/jw-12-2000/jw-1221-junit_p.html
http://www-106.ibm.com/developerworks/library/j-ant/?dwzone=java
http://users.vnet.net/wwake/xp/xp0001/index.shtml

Best of luck!

Jon

-----Original Message-----
From: Jason Rogers [mailto:jason.rogers@...]
Sent: Friday, July 06, 2001 10:50 AM
To: 'junit@yahoogroups.com'
Subject: RE: [junit] new to junit


Go through the examples that come with JUnit. They are very helpful. This
shouldn't take too long.

As use is often the best tutorial, write a hello-world class and associated
test that tests perhaps that a certain message is printed to the output
stream that you give it. The set-up of your objects is simple. Create
HelloWorld (no inheritance needed) and HelloWorldTest (extending TestCase).
If you want your test case to setup anything special (i.e. your output
stream) put it in your setUp() then "destroy" it in your tearDown().

Hope that helps.

-Jason
